intro: Acianthera punicea, commonly known as the pink orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, thick rhizome and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and its inflorescence consists of a single spike bearing several flowers. Acianthera punicea is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its ornamental value has made it a popular subject in horticulture and botanical studies.
